page.title: 01Pakenham and Stowlangtoft
page.content: Pakenham is a small village about four miles from Bury St. Edmunds.Pakenham is the only village in England with a working windmill and a watermill. Pakenham school has a small number of children (30-40). The children come from Pakenham village and by bus from Stowlangtoft. Stowlangtoft is a hamlet about two miles from Pakenham. About two-thirds of the farm land in Pakenham is owned by Mr Whitwell.We have a telephone exchange,a pub called the Fox,there is a Mace shop- Mr & Mrs Crass own the shop . There is a Post Office ,it is owned by Mr & Mrs Bacon. We have a church with a service every Sunday. There is a petrol station , a blacksmith and village hall. A lot of people work in Bury, and live in Pakenham.There is a small council estate and a small private deveopment.
